means: （人或罪行）该处罚的，可惩罚的

sentence.Network_en: They called on the authorities to make slavery a punishable offence.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们呼吁当局将蓄奴定为一种应该受到惩罚的罪行。

sentence.Network_en: Infringement of the regulation is punishable by a fine.
Treason in this country is still punishable by death.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这个国家，叛国仍然是可判死罪的。

entry.def: If a crime is punishable in a particular way, anyone who commits it is punished in that way.

example.ex: Treason in this country is still punishable by death...
example.tran: 在这个国家，叛国仍然是可判死罪的。

example.ex: They called on the authorities to make slavery a punishable offence.
example.tran: 他们呼吁当局将蓄奴定为一种应该受到惩罚的罪行。

auth_sentence.content: Sedition is a crime punishable by death in Iran.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sedition is a crime punishable by death in Iran.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sedition is a crime punishable by death in Iran.

auth_sentence.content: Defection can be punishable by death in North Korea.
auth_sentence.res_content: Defection can be punishable by death in North Korea.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Defection can be punishable by death in North Korea.

auth_sentence.content: Membership in the Brotherhood is punishable by death in Syria.
auth_sentence.res_content: Membership in the Brotherhood is punishable by death in Syria.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Membership in the Brotherhood is punishable by death in Syria.

means.word_mean: (人或罪行)该处罚的；可惩罚的

sentences.en: Child abuse is a punishable offense.
sentences.cn: 虐待儿童是一种该受惩处的违法行为。
以前乱伦罪可判处死刑。
